# Game Mechanics Section
Game Mechanics
# Amenities / Happiness changes
Global Changes
All cities other than your capital start with +1 amenity bonus. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Happy cities receive +8% yields (from +10%) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Ecstatic cities receive +16% yields (from +20%)
# Combat changes
Combat
[ICON_BULLET] +2 Combat Strength per turn of fortification up to a maximum of +4CS (from +3CS per turn up to a maximum of +6CS) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Land units no longer provide support bonus in water
# Congress changes
Congress
[ICON_BULLET] [b]Unit Production Congress:[/b] Modified to +50% cost in production / gold / faith (from +100%) or -25% cost in production / gold / faith (from -50%) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Trade Treaty:[/b] congress vote option B changed to "-4 gold on Trade Routes sent to/from target player" [i](note: this can result in negative gpt trade routes)[/i]
# Diplomatic Favor changes
Diplomatic Favor
Conquering a Capital now gives +2 Diplomatic Favor instead of -2
# Disasters changes
Disasters
[ICON_BULLET] Droughts and Tornados removed entirely [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Meteors removed on all disaster settings except for disaster 4 [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Reduced odds of completely pillaging a district and improvement on disasters [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Natural disasters won't kill civilian units other than rare circumstances with natural wonders [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Production yields from floods reduced to compensate the [b]Watermill[/b] change
# Specialists changes
Specialists
Working specialist slots are buffed in the following manner: [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Campus: 3 science, 4 science w/ Research Labs (from 2s, 3s @ Labs) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Theater Square: 2 culture, 3 culture w/ Broadcast Center (from 2c, 3c @ Broadcast) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Commercial Hub: unchanged [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Harbor: 1 food + 3 gold, 2 food + 3 gold w/ Seaport (from 1f+2g, 2f+2g @ Seaport) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Holy Site: 3 faith, 4 faith w/ Tier 3 building (from 2fm 3f @ Tier 3) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Industrial Zone: 4 production always (from 2p, 3p @ Powerplant) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Encampment: 2 production + 2 gold, 3 production + 2 gold w/ Military Academy (from 1p+2g, 2p+2g @ Academy)
# Spies changes
Spies
When a spy is captured, you gain +1 spy capacity. This is because in multiplayer, especially team games, there is no way of getting your spy back unlike if it is killed.
# Tribal Huts changes
Tribal Huts
Relic Reward: the possibility of relics are delayed until turn 15 (from start of game)
# Techs and Civics Section
Techs and Civics
# Civics Changes
Civics
Civics Tree Changes [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Nationalism inspiration changed to "Own a Level 3 Land Unit" (from Start a war using a Casus Belli)
# Technologies Changes
Technologies
All technologies after the Classical Era cost 5% more science. [NEWLINE] Era Gate for technologies is increased to 30% (from 20% base game). This is a mechanic when you are researching technologies of an era ahead of the current game era whereby the cost of those technologies is increased. [NEWLINE] Tech Tree Changes [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Advanced Ballistics moved to a Modern Era technology, no dependencies changed. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Steam Power now requires Scientific Theory [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Steel eureka changed to "Own a Renaissance Wall" (from Build a Coal Mine and Ironclad)
# Victory Conditions Section
Victory Conditions
# Empty string for spacing
The default "Legacy BBG" setting on game setup changes several victory conditions for viability in multiplayer. These settings may be adjusted by changing "Legacy BBG" to "Custom" or set to default Firaxis settings by changing this to "Standard"
Legacy BBG Settings
This is the default setting for online competitive multiplayer when using BBG. This setting changes the below victory conditions as described.
[u][b]Cultural Victory[/b][/u] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Base tourism from wonders adjusted to 5 (from 2). [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Number of tourism needed to gain a tourist lowered to 150 per player (from 200). [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Computer and Environmentalism boost tourism by 50% (from 25%). [NEWLINE] [u]Great Work Update:[/u] [NEWLINE] Great works of Art are locked to their location for only 2 turns when moved or created. Art by the same artist no longer receives a penalty when in the same Art Museum. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Writing: 4 culture and 2 tourism each (from 2 culture / 2 tourism), additional +2 tourism at Opera and Ballet [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Art: 4 culture and 4 tourism each (from 3 culture / 3 tourism), additional +50% tourism at Steam Power [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Music: 12 culture and 8 tourism each (from 4 culture / 4 tourism) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Artifact: 6 culture and 8 tourism each (from 3 culture / 3 tourism) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Relic: 4 faith and 4 tourism (from 4 faith / 8 tourism) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Rock Bands: Potential album sales results reduced by 20% to be 80% of the default value
[u][b]Diplomatic Victory[/b][/u] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] First world congress is in Medieval Era [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] First vote for Diplomatic Victory points is in Medieval Era [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Diplomatic point penalty from grievances is removed
[u][b]Score Victory[/b][/u] Score is often used in determining placement in CPL Free for All (FFA) games. The following changes have been made to the scoring system: [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Points for era score are removed [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Each Civic = 4 points (from 3) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Each Technology = 3 points (from 2) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Each City = 2 points (from 5) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Each Population = 2 points (from 1) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Each World Wonder = 4 points (from 15) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Each Great Person = 3 points (from 5) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Each Foreign city following your religion = 1 point (from 2) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Each District = 2 points unchanged [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Each Unique District = 4 points unchanged [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Each Building = 1 point unchanged [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Founding a Religion = 10 points unchanged
Custom Settings
Below are the options available when choosing "Custom" settings for each victory condition.
[u][b]Culture Victory[/b][/u] [NEWLINE] Standard - default Firaxis settings [NEWLINE] Early - great works and Artifacts provide more tourism [NEWLINE] Earliest - default Legacy BBG setting - Great Works and Artifacts provide more tourism and tourism per tourist is reduced by 25%
[u][b]Science Victory[/b][/u] [NEWLINE] Standard - default Firaxis settings, default Legacy BBG setting [NEWLINE] Early - cheaper space projects and lowered cost for future era techs [NEWLINE] Earliest - even cheaper space projects and even lowered cost for future era techs
[u][b]Diplomatic Victory[/b][/u] [NEWLINE] Standard - default Firaxis settings [NEWLINE] Early - first congress in Medieval Era, first vote for diplo points in Renaissance Era [NEWLINE] Earliest - default Legacy BBG setting - first congress and first vote for diplo points in Medieval Era
[u][b]Conquest / Domination Victory[/b][/u] [NEWLINE] Standard - default Firaxis settings, default Legacy BBG setting - can only be on or off, no option for early or earliest due to the nature of domination victories
[u][b]Territorial Victory[/b][/u] [NEWLINE] This is a new victory type that may optionally be added to your game when playing with BBG. The game is won by having a certain percentage of the world's emerged land tiles, in your territory. This percentage varies based on the setting chosen below. [NEWLINE] **Note** This victory type was bugged at one point by having Rome in the game and/or Torres del Paine. The bug results in Rome randomly winning the game. At the time of the writing of these patch notes, it is believed that this bug has been fixed. You may want to turn Rome off
[NEWLINE] Standard - 66% of emerged land tiles [NEWLINE] Early - 60% of emerged land tiles [NEWLINE] Earliest - 50% of emerged land tiles [NEWLINE] Off - default Legacy BBG setting
[u][b]Religious Victory[/b][/u] [NEWLINE] Standard - default Firaxis settings, default Legacy BBG setting, religious pressure extends 12 tiles (from 10) [NEWLINE] Early - religious pressure extends 12 tiles [NEWLINE] Earliest - religious pressure extends 13 tiles
[u][b]Score Victory[/b][/u] [NEWLINE] Standard - default Firaxis settings, default Legacy BBG setting, 250 turns online speed / 500 standard speed [NEWLINE] Early - 175 turns online speed / 350 standard speed [NEWLINE] Earliest - 150 turns online speed / 300 standard speed
# Districts Section
Districts
District Cost and Discount Mechanic

Campus
No changes

+1 adjacency from city centers (from +0) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Market[/b]: [NEWLINE][/t]+2 gold (from +3 to balance the adjacency change on comm hub) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Bank[/b]: [NEWLINE][/t]+6 gold (from +5) [NEWLINE][/t]+2 Great Merchant point (from +1) [NEWLINE][/t]Trade routes from cities with bank yield +2 gold. [NEWLINE][/t]Trade routes to cities with bank yield +1 gold. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Stock Exchange[/b]: [NEWLINE][/t]+8 gold (from +4) [NEWLINE][/t]Powered yield : +12 gold (from +7) [NEWLINE][/t]+3 Great Merchant point (from +1) [NEWLINE][/t]Trade route from cities with Stock Exchange yield +4 gold. Production cost is now the same as Aqueduct, 36 base. (from 81). [NEWLINE] Canal moved to Buttress (from Steam Power)
Encampment
[ICON_BULLET][b]Barracks, Stable, and Replacements[/b]: +2 production (from +2 production for units) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Armory[/b]: +2 Great General points (from +1), and gives +1 niter [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Military Academy[/b]: +2 Great General points (from +1), and +2 oil once revealed
Entertainment Complex
[ICON_BULLET][b]Entertainment Complex[/b]: +2 amenities (from +1) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Arena[/b]: +3 tourism and no longer requires conservation (from +1) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Stadium[/b]: +6 tourism / +15 when powered (from +2/+5)
Government Plaza
[ICON_BULLET][b]Audience Chamber[/b]: +3 food (from +0), +1 amenity (from +2), +3 housing (from +4) in all cities with a governor. Harbor
[ICON_BULLET][b]Shipyard[/b]: +1 coal once revealed (from +0) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Seaport[/b]: +3 great admiral points (from +1)
Industrial Zone
[ICON_BULLET][b]Workshop[/b]: cost = 160 production (from 195) and +4 production (from +3) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Factory[/b]: cost = 290 production (from 330) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Coal Power Plant[/b]: cost = 330 production (from 300) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Oil Power Plant[/b]: +6 production (from +3), unlocked at Refining (from Electricity) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Nuclear Power Plant[/b]: +8 production (from +4) +6 science (from +3)
Neighborhood
Production cost reduced to 40 base. (from 54). [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Shopping Mall[/b]: +20 tourism (from +4), +10 gold / +10 additional gold when powered (from +2/+2)
Preserve
Preserve yield +1 food to incoming domestic trade route and +1 faith to incoming international trade route. [NEWLINE] Fixed a bug that prevented preserves from being discounted like other districts. [NEWLINE] They can now be discounted. [NEWLINE] [b]Grove[/b]: +1 Food and Faith on tiles with Charming or less appeal, +1 Culture on Tiles with Charming appeal, +2 Food/Faith/Culture on tiles with Breathtaking appeal [NEWLINE] [b]Sanctuary[/b]: +1 Science and Gold if the tile is Charming or less appeal, +1 production if the tile is Charming, +2 Science/Gold/Production if the tile is Breathtaking Appeal
Water Park
[ICON_BULLET][b]Ferris Wheel[/b]: +6 tourism (from +2) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Aquatics Center[/b]: +6 tourism from each wonder building in this city on or adjacent to the coast (from +2)
# Improvements Section
Improvements
All improvements correctly give tourism at flight equal to their culture value unless stated otherwise, this is a fix to a Firaxis bug. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Fishing Boats[/b]: give +1 production. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Fisheries[/b]: moved to Celestial Navigation (from Liang promote). +1 Housing (from +0.5) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Fort[/b]: Now gives +1 vision and unlocked at Military Engineering (from Siege Tactics). Vision also includes unique forts (Pa, Great Wall, Alcazar) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Lumber Mill[/b]: +1 production at Ballistics and Synthetic Materials (from Steel and Cybernetics). [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Plantations[/b]: gives +1 production if built on a flat tile. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Geothermal Plant[/b]: moved to Chemistry (from Synthetic Materials; +3 power (from +4), additional +3 power and +1 science at Synthetic Materials) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Quarry[/b]: +1 production at Military Engineering (from Gunpowder), +2 production at Rocketry (from +1 Rocketry and +1 Predictive Systems) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Railroads[/b]: cost 1 iron (from 1 iron 1 coal), unlocked at Scientific Theory (from Steam Power) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Seaside Resorts[/b]: minimum appeal of charming (from breathtaking), can be built on hills, tourism and gold equal to 200% of appeal (from 100%)
# Resources Section
Resources
Luxury Resources: [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Jade[/b]: +1 production, but can no longer spawn on plains (from +0, plains and grassland) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Mercury[/b]: +1 food / +1 science (from +0/+1) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Pearls[/b]: +1 production / +1 faith (from +0/+1) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Spices[/b]: +1 food / +1 gold (from +2/+0) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Tea[/b]: +1 food / +1 science (from +0/+1) [NEWLINE] Strategic Resources: [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Oil[/b]: Can spawn on flat plains and floodplains
# Units Section
Military Units
Prebuild System Nerf
Units now become obsolete when the unit +2 is unlocked. (ex: heavy chariot is obsolete at cuirassiers, warriors obsolete at men at arms, swords obsolete at musketmen, quadriremes obsolete at battleships)
Unique Unit (UU) Prebuild Nerf
To stay consistent with the above change, UU's also obsolete when you unlock unit+2 (for example it was previously possible to build/buy Mandekalu Cavalry even after unlocking tanks)
Anti-Cavalry
Thrust promotion is +10 Combat Strength vs Melee (from +5) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Pikemen[/b]: cost adjusted to 200 standard speed (from 180) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Pike and Shot[/b]: cost adjusted to 290 standard speed (from 250) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]AT Crew[/b]: 80 combat strength (from 75) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Modern AT[/b]: 90 combat strength (from 85)
Light Cavalry
[ICON_BULLET][b]Courser[/b]: cost adjusted to 180 standard speed (from 200) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Cavalry[/b]: cost adjusted to 310 standard speed (from 330) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Helicopter[/b]: require 1 oil to maintain (from 1 aluminum), 5 movement (from 4)

[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Mechanized Infantry[/b]: 90 combat strength (from 85)
